findings.issue: Assumes normal distribution for elasticity parameter without justification from empirical studies
GDP impact calculation oversimplified - doesn't account for multiplier effects or economic complexity

findings.quote: The model assumes uniform effects across demographics
findings.issue: Assuming uniform effects invalidates results - labor supply elasticity varies significantly by income level

errorDetails.raw:
[FINDING]
Category: statistical_validity
Severity: minor
Line: 89
Quote: "90% CI: " + String(quantile(impact.percentChange, 0.05), ".1f") + "% to " + String(quantile(impact.percentChange, 0.95), ".1f")
Issue: Using 5th and 95th percentiles to construct confidence interval without verifying distribution assumptions
[/FINDING]

errorDetails.raw:
[FINDING]
Category: statistical_validity
Severity: major
Line: 45
Quote: "incomeEffect = inputs.incomeElasticity * (inputs.ubiAmount / (inputs.avgWage * inputs.baseWorkHours))"
Issue: Linear elasticity application may not hold for large income changes or across income distributions
[/FINDING]
